answer:
No. The FAA defines a high-performance aircraft as  an airplane with an engine capable of developing more than 200 horsepower. In this case the aircraft has no engine capable of more then 200 horsepower.

(Airplane Flying Handbook, 11-1, 14 CFR §61.31(f)(1) )
question: Is a twin engine plane with two 200hp engines considered by the FAA to be a high performance aircraft?
